thread.title: GM Volt Among Best Hybrid, EV Buys As Race Heats Up - Investors.com
thread.title_full: GM Volt Among Best Hybrid, EV Buys As Race Heats Up - Investors.com

author: yahoo
title: GM Volt Among Best Hybrid, EV Buys As Race Heats Up - Investors.com
text:
K elley Blue Book has announced its 2016 Best Buy Award finalists list, and those in the electric/hybrid category include General Motors' (NYSE: GM ) Chevrolet Volt, Toyota's (NYSE: TM ) Mirai, which is powered by a fuel cell, and Volkswagen's (OTCPK: VLKAY ) e-Golf.
Tesla Motors (NASDAQ: TSLA ) wasn't considered for the list because the category has a $75,000 price cap, a Kelley Blue Book representative said.
Meanwhile, Chevrolet is expected to show off its Bolt electric vehicle concept car, which is seen as a possible competitor to Tesla's Model 3 mass-market EV, at an event Thursday in Los Angeles.
  View Enlarged Image 
GM also plans to use a Chevy Volt to test self-driving technologies, as Tesla and other Silicon Valley heavyweights like Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL ) and Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOGL ) look to disrupt the auto sector with autonomous vehicles.
For its self-driving Volt, GM is working with Mobileye (NYSE: MBLY ), which also provides its advanced driver assistance technology to Tesla.
GM shares closed up 0.3% on the stock market today . Toyota fell 1.7% and VW ended 3.9% lower. Tesla finished 1.7% higher, and Apple rallied 0.2%. Mobileye dipped 0.1%.
Kelley Blue Book Senior Vehicle Evaluations Editor Richard Homan called the Volt a "a completely useable hybrid" because it can go all electric or run on gasoline. He also noted the Volt's all-electric range has increased to 50 miles from 34 miles last year, while the price has come down.
Homan said the Mirai is "kind of like driving a possible future," adding that more fuel cell infrastructure could be built in the future.
"Whether it's EVs or fuel cell cars, all the manufacturers have big plans for future cars," he told IBD.
In Kelley Blue Book's luxury category, finalists were winnowed down to the Acura ILX, Lexus GS and Mercedes-Benz C-Class. In the performance category, the revamped Chevrolet Camaro, Chevrolet Corvette, Ford (NYSE: F ) GT350, Mazda MX-5 Miata and Scion FR-S are finalists.
Among pickup trucks, Ford's F-150, the best selling vehicle of any type in the U.S. for more than three decades running, made the finalist list. It's joined by the Chevrolet Colorado, Nissan Motor's (OTCPK: NSANY ) Nissan Titan and the Toyota Tacoma.
Small car finalists include Honda's (NYSE: HMC ) Civic and the Hyundai Elantra, Scion iM, Subaru Impreza and Toyota Corolla. Among full-size SUVs, the Chevrolet Tahoe, Ford Expedition and Toyota Sequoia are finalists.
Follow James DeTar on Twitter @IBD_JDeTar and Facebook .
